trial_identification.studytitle: Effects of a Mediterranean style diet on vascular health in Type 2 diabetes.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of a Mediterranean style diet versus a conventional High carbohydrate, low fat diet on glycaemic and lipid control and on vascular inflammatory markers in people with newly diagnosed type 2 diabetes.

interventions.interventions: The study consists of a randomised six-month dietary intervention with individuals assigned to either the intervention group (HVM diet) or the control group (High carbohydrate, low fat: HCLF diet). Each group receives individualised dietary education and is provided with written dietary education materials. Subjects attend for review at 3 and 6 months, and are also contacted by telephone after the first month. Outcome measures are assessed at study entry and after six months of dietary therapy. Measures of glycaemic control and standard lipids are analysed and analysis undertaken for assessment of biomarkers of inflammation and endothelial cell function as well as markers of dietary adherence.
interventions.comparator: Control group (High carbohydrate, low fat: HCLF diet).

primaryOutcome.outcome: HBAIc at study entry and 6 months after dietary intervention
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At study entry and 6 months after dietary intervention

primaryOutcome.outcome: Lipids (Cholesterol, HDL-cholesterol, Triglycerides) at study entry and 6 months after dietary intervention
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At study entry and 6 months after dietary intervention

secondaryOutcome.outcome: TNF-a, IL-6, High sensitivity CRP, plasma carotenoids and serum fatty acids.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: These biochemical parameters are measured at study entry (baseline) and at six months post completion of the dietary intervention period.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: For our study we are recruiting 24 English speaking people with newly diagnosed Type 2 diabetes (within 3-12 months of diagnosis) who are attending the Alfred Hospital, Diabetes Education Outpatient Clinic.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: body mass index (BMI) < 25 kg/m2 or >37 kg/m2; on corticosteroid or insulin therapy; presence of established renal and/or liver disease (serum creatinine more than 0.12 mmol/L/albumin excretion rate greater than 300 Ã¿Âµg per minute or ALT more than twice the upper limit of normal respectively).

trial_design.concealment: Odd numbers are assigned to the intervention group (HVM diet) while even numbers are assigned to the control group (HCLF diet). Randomisation is noted blinded as the clinician provides dietary education to enrolled participants and participants upon allocation are aware of the dietary intervention that they have been assigned to.
